channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Support pole of tree damaged and causing hazard, 3rd August
item.description:
There are two support poles on the tree outside 26 Greencourt Road. One has been badly damaged and is out of the ground and only hanging on to the tree by the attached rope. The pole is not secure and is liable to swing and hit passing pedestrians or traffic in windy conditions. The pole is also not providing the support it should to the tree and potentially causing damage to the tree’s growth
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greencourt Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo and rubbish, 3rd August
item.description:
The neighbours allowing there dog to defecate on the pebbles under the tree. And there is a lot of rubbish behind the gate near the stairs. Please inform the residents to clear up there dog mess.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Elmbridge Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic cones dumped on pavement for several weeks, 3rd August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greencourt Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Japanese knotweed outside perimeter of property, 3rd August
item.description:
I believe there is a thicket of Japanese knotweed just outside the perimeter of mine (68 upper abbey road, behind rear fence) and my neighbour's property. Please remove before it spreads! The shoots appeared early this year and since they appeared on the other side of my fence, I didn't see the shoots until they became really tall. If this isn't Japanese knotweed, Id appreciate it if it was nevertheless removed . Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clive Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stone bollard damaged, 3rd August
item.description:
The pebble stone bollard is damaged and is very unstable. It’s could fall on young children if pushed.needs refining and cementing on the ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Crescent, London

item.title: The ‘Give Way’ sign is dislodged from its position, 3rd August
item.description:
The ‘Give Way’ sign on the junction between ‘York Street’ and ‘Upper Montagu Street’ has become dislodged and needs to be re-secured to its position, to prevent it falling on a pedestrian below, and ensuring vehicles don’t cross the junction when they need to ‘Give Way’ to prevent a vehicle collision.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Upper Montagu Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More disgusting items fly tipped, 3rd August
item.description:
DO SOMETHING. INSTALL CCTV. PROSECUTE THE FLY TIPPERS. PROVIDE PROPER BINS. PROVIDE A GATE: Now a soiled mattress, dirty clothes and food waste all over bins and pavement. On top of existing 10ft sheets of wood, toilet, broken planks, cabinet. A disgrace.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Monteagle Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Add a second bin to this area + pickup rubbish, 3rd August
item.description:
Bin is constantly full with rubbish falling off of it - even when people aren't fly tipping, you can see people try their best but there isn't enough room. Issue happens every other day in between pickups so it's not an isolated incident. This area really needs a second bin - it's a busy area with families and kids playing and the area should be kept clean. Problem is worse at weekends. It makes the area and our neighbourhood unpleasant to live in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chambers Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish removal request near station exit, 3rd August
item.description:
There’s a build-up of rubbish near the station exit, tucked between the building and the fence. It’s been left there for quite a while now! Can this please be cleared? It’s becoming an eyesore and a potential health hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Henley Cross, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet
